column4: anyone able to look a the paste bin?  id greatly appreciate guidance
does it boot slow more than one time?
lets take a look at the file /etc/fstab  pastebinit
I'm not sure, I don't see anything wrong, maybe it's a power up thing takes time for some device to start?
looks like a new problem so maybe go back to an older kernel
installing a kernel is much the same as install any other package
a swap drive is optional in your case it might be used to go from hybernate or standby to powerup.
did it have that problem when you booted from the cd or usb?
well then maybe the kernel version used in the cd/usb boot would be better
the cd boot linux version is many times an older version than what then end up installing
boot one of your cd/usb and do the command uname -a ;  to find out
you can also look in synaptic search for linux-image to see what versions of linux are available to install
that would require modifing the file /etc/fstab
